column4: a process has the parent process with the pid "1". What is that process? Where should I look in order to _not_ have this child process started?
a grep for "wpa" in /etc/init returns nothing, odd
(wpa_supplicant is the name of the process that init starts on boot that I'd like to disable)
I hope it's not a laptop you hope to use to connect to wifi
I prefer wpa_supplicant + dhclient in a screen to network-manager
well then I hope all you wifi will never be encrypted
well I'm an anti network-manger guy so I'm sure there are other methods
you're not using network-manager? If not, do you also have a wpa_supplicant running when you boot?
no I write scripts or run static in most cases
btw, not looking forward to connecting to a wpa2 enterprise network, that's pretty nasty with wpa_supplicant.conf it seems
good point as this is a box that will never touch wifi direct but probly might have wpa_supplicant running
that's what I ended up doing is uninstalling network-manager package
I just noted that with my wpa-supplicant isn't running so I guess not having network-manager installed has made it go away
yeah I just uninstalled network-manager, it works fine now
